description: An Ontario Superior Court judge has dismissed an attempt to add Maple Leaf Foods to a class-action lawsuit related to the bread-price fixing scandal. When the class-action lawsuit was originally certified in an Ontario court in 2021 against several grocery retailers and other food companies, Maple Leaf was not included. Plantiffs, supported by Canada Bread […]
title: Efforts to Add Maple Leaf Foods to Bread-Price Fixing Class Action Denied

description: The CRTC has set interim rates for what smaller internet providers will have to pay to use the established fibre networks of their larger rivals. The pricing comes as the national telecoms regulator works to expand nationally a mandate already in two provinces requiring the big telecom companies to share their fibre networks. “Today’s decision […]
title: CRTC Sets Interim Rates for Wholesale Fibre Internet Access

description: Employers and the union representing foremen at British Columbia’s ports will return to the negotiating table next week with a mediator in the latest push for a resolution in the labour dispute. The BC Maritime Employers Association says in a statement that it will meet Oct. 29 with the International Longshore and Warehouse Union Local […]
title: BC Port Employers, Foremen’s Union Return to Negotiation Table With Mediator

description: Senior executives from Google and X identified China as the top source of foreign interference and disinformation campaigns during their testimonies to the Canadian House of Commons ethics committee on Oct. 24. During the committee meeting, Conservative MP Michael Cooper asked the X platform representative which foreign state is the most active in spreading or […]
title: Google, X Executives Name China as Top Disinformation Offender

description: It’s out with the old and in with the new at the Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) in the New Year. The TTC will ring in 2025 by completing its transition to its completely digital tap-and-ride PRESTO fare system. That makes Dec. 31, 2024, the final day that tickets, tokens, and day passes will be accepted […]
title: New Year’s Eve Last Day to Use TTC Tokens, Day Passes

description: Experts say vague treaty language and a growing reliance on space-based technology has made Earth's orbit the target of a new arms race.
title: The Battle for Space Is On

description: Commentary Public support for the Liberal Party of Canada has sharply declined for over a year. The party desperately needs to change the channel as Canada enters an anticipated election year. Parties have three options in front of them when they have become stale in the eyes of the voters and have lost public support: […]
title: Cory Morgan: A Strong Policy Pivot Would Be a Smart Move for Liberals at This Time

description: Commentary It’s no secret that high school graduation means far less than it used to. “Individualized progress plans” for those who can’t meet the universal standard, social promotion, and increasing accommodation for mental health concerns like anxiety mean that having a high school degree is now no guarantee of literacy or numeracy. The collapse of […]
title: Lowering Standards for Med School in the Name of Diversity Is Endangering Patients

description: Ontario’s premier says he is frustrated by stories of “unacceptable” spending by provincial school boards, which have prompted recent audits by the education minister. “They frustrate me,” Premier Doug Ford said during an unrelated Oct. 25 news conference in Oshawa when a reporter asked if it was time to do away with the school board […]
title: Ontario Premier ‘Frustrated’ by School Board Spending on Trustee Trips

description: Former SDA leader Joe De Bruyn wanted to make a point when he addressed a room of university graduates—to stand up for what you believe, no matter what.
title: What Drove a Former Union Leader to Give an Abortion Speech That Led to a Student Walkout?

description: Canada’s commitments to United Nations pacts have motivated policy decisions in many ways over the years. In September, Canada ratified the U.N.’s new Pact for the Future, a broad agreement that aims to strengthen previous pacts and sets goals for many areas of governance, including the internet, artificial intelligence, plastic waste, and weapons. The wording […]
title: How UN Pacts Become Policy in Canada; ‘Pact for the Future’ Is Next

description: Ontario property owners who regularly rent out their homes on platforms like Airbnb could be required to pay 13 percent HST when selling the property, according to a recent court ruling. HST does not usually apply to the sale of a residential property that has been previously occupied, according to the Canadian Revenue Agency (CRA). […]
title: Ontario Homeowners Renting Regularly on Airbnb Face 13% Tax When Property Is Sold: Court Ruling

description: Bank of Canada governor Tiff Macklem says the world has become more prone to supply shocks which create more risks to inflation, but the central bank is in a better place to deal with them now that inflation is under control. However, he said the capacity for monetary policy to stabilize output in the face […]
title: ‘Shock-Prone World’ Highlights Need for Productivity: Bank of Canada Governor

description: While many conservationists support renewable energy, the development of wind farms is proving to be divisive.
title: Caught in the Wind:  Conservationists Say Wind Farms Pose a Threat to Australia’s Endangered Koalas

description: Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly said Friday that Canada strongly condemns a new surge of “horrifying violence” perpetrated by gangs in Haiti. Gang violence has increased in the Caribbean nation in recent weeks and the UN says gangs now control 85 percent of the capital city of Port-au-Prince. Kenya is leading a multinational security mission […]
title: Canada Condemns ‘Horrifying’ Violence in Haiti as Political Transition Challenged

description: The federal government has passed new regulations allowing Canada Post to store and transport restricted firearms as part of its firearms buyback program. The Oct. 16 order-in-council will allow couriers at the postal service to transport prohibited firearms to disposal facilities to be destroyed. The Liberal government’s firearms buyback program is expected to begin in […]
title: New Regulations Allow Canada Post to Transport Restricted Guns in Firearms Buyback

description: Liberal MPs who had publicly voiced their preference for a leadership change in their party said they are disappointed Prime Minister Justin Trudeau did not reflect longer on his future after a tense caucus meeting this week. Some MPs made the case at the Oct. 23 meeting that Trudeau should move aside to improve the […]
title: Dissenting Liberal MPs React to Trudeau’s Quick Decision to Remain as Leader

description: Co-op Food has said it spent £18 million so far this year on measures to protect staff, including fortified kiosks and body-worn cameras.
title: Shoplifting Offences Hit New 20-Year High: ONS

description: British Sleep Society says the idea we should stay on British Summer Time is misguided as our natural ryhthms would benefit from staying on Greenwich Mean Time.
title: Nation’s Health Affected by Clocks Changing, Researchers Say

description: Advocacy groups called for urgent measures to protect Canadian democracy and vulnerable communities from Beijing’s interference as the foreign interference inquiry wrapped up public hearings on Oct. 24. “I will suggest that today, more than ever before in this country, people of Chinese descent face unprecedented challenges arising from foreign interference,” said Neil Chantler, counsel […]
title: Inquiry Hearings Conclude With Groups Urging Action to Curb CCP Interference

description: The federal government’s deficit was $9.8 billion for the April-to-August period. The Finance Department’s latest fiscal monitor says the result compared with a deficit of $4.3 billion during the same period a year earlier. Revenue for the period rose by $16.7 billion or 9.3 percent compared with a year earlier due to increases in all […]
title: Federal Government Posts $9.8-Billion Deficit for April-to-August Period

description: An Alberta murder suspect out on bail is wanted by the RCMP after she allegedly assaulted an officer while resisting arrest before subsequently fleeing the scene. Wetaskiwin resident Talsa Ashlee Cardinal, 31, was released from custody with a 24-hour curfew on March 29 after being charged with first-degree murder in connection with a shooting in […]
title: Alberta Murder Suspect Out on Bail Now Wanted for Officer Assault, Curfew Breach

description: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva holds a press briefing as world financial leaders gather for the IMF-World Bank annual meetings at 1:15 p.m. ET on Oct. 25.
title: IMF Chief Briefs Press at IMF-World Bank Annual Meeting

description: Canadian retail sales rose 0.4 percent to $66.6 billion in August, helped by higher new car sales, Statistics Canada said Friday. However, core retail sales—which exclude gasoline stations and fuel vendors and motor vehicle and parts dealers—fell 0.4 percent in August. “The details of the August retail sales report were softer than the headline increase, […]
title: Retail Sales up Slightly in August as Consumer Spending Remains Muted

description: The Senedd cannot change the law, with that power resting with Westminster, but the vote demonstrates a symbolic rejection of legalising the measures in Wales.
title: Welsh Parliament Rejects Support for Assisted Suicide

description: Elections BC is expected to provide a breakdown today of the number of uncounted mail-in and absentee ballots in each of British Columbia’s 93 ridings, potentially making clearer the outcome of the weekend’s nail-biting vote. There are about 65,000 of the ballots to count between tomorrow and Monday, which could solidify results from election night, […]

description: Both the prime minister and the king are attending the Commonwealth summit in Samoa, with calls from some former colonies for the UK to make amends for history.
title: Starmer Rules out Financial Reparations for Slave Trade

description: ROME—Archaeologists in the ancient Roman city of Pompeii have uncovered a richly decorated but uncommonly small house with finely preserved frescoes of mythological scenes, the site said on Thursday. The dwelling, called the House of Phaedra after the mythological queen of Athens who features in one of its wall paintings, sheds light on changing architectural […]
title: Ancient Pompeii Site Uncovers Tiny House With Exquisite Frescoes

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine expects Russia to deploy North Korean soldiers to combat zones by the end of October.

description: Rising crime and revitalising businesses key to winning voters' hearts from mailed-in preferences.

description: Commentary During Napoleon’s lifetime, French Canadians feared and opposed him. But later on, Quebecers, like almost everyone else, made a heroic myth of the man Napoleon Bonaparte, the former artillery officer and self-crowned emperor who ruled France between 1799 and 1815 and conquered half of Europe, is history’s ultimate heroic-romantic figure. As a ruler, builder, […]
title: The Napoleon Myth in Quebec: From Aversion to Adulation

description: MEXICO CITY—A shootout between two battling criminal groups in Mexico’s southern Pacific state of Guerrero on Thursday left 16 people dead, authorities said, as the country has been hit by a wave of recent violence. Around 5 a.m. on Thursday morning, warring cartels were facing off in the state’s rural, mountainous region, which has become […]
title: Shootout Between Warring Cartels Leaves 16 Dead in Southern Mexico

description: The report calls for a form of 'student number controls' to prevent top universities from lowering their tariffs to compensate for falling numbers.
title: Universities Facing ‘Serious Problems’ as Number of 18-Year-Olds Is Set to Decline: Report

description: U.S. government reaches $102 million settlement in Baltimore bridge disaster; and the number of early voters in the November election passes 30 million.

description: Daniel Suidani and a former political adviser were recently charged with unlawful assembly related to protests in 2021.

description: ACAMBARO, Mexico—A car bomb left outside a police station in the town of Acambaro in western Mexico wounded three people, prosecutors in the violence-wracked state of Guanajuato said Thursday. They said another explosion, apparently a second car bomb, occurred in the nearby town of Jerecuaro. Although nobody was wounded, the force of that second blast […]
title: Car Bomb Explodes Outside Police Station in Western Mexico, Wounding 3 Officers

description: YENAGOA—At least three people died when a helicopter crashed in Nigeria on its way to an offshore oil production facility on Thursday, the state-owned oil firm NNPC said. The helicopter, operated by East Winds Aviation, lost contact while flying from Port Harcourt to the Floating Production Storage and Offloading (FPSO) Antan oil production facility, NNPC […]
title: At Least 3 Killed in Nigeria Helicopter Crash, Oil Firm NNPC Says

description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark—At least one person was killed and four people injured when a train running along Norway’s northern coast derailed Thursday with 55 people on board, police said. The Arctic Circle Express was on its way from Trondheim to the remote northern town of Bodoe, above the Arctic Circle, when it left the mountainside track. […]
title: Train Carrying 55 People Derails on Norway’s North Coast, Killing at Least 1 and Injuring 4

description: The soon-to-be-closed network will affect not only mobile phones but also watches, iPads, medical devices, and farming technology.

description: The state's peak real estate body has cautioned against making conditions too onerous for landlords citing the situation in New Zealand and Victoria.

description: According to the Council, home deliveries have reached their lowest level since 2013, with only 6,948 new homes built in the March quarter of 2024.

description: 'It's good news for the uranium export miners at the moment,' said Mark Weaver, a general manager at the Australian Radioactive Waste Agency.

description: Despite a slight improvement in health-care wait times, 3-5 million Canadians are still on waiting lists, according to a recent report. The findings, by think tank SecondStreet, include provincial data on waitlists for surgery, diagnostic testing, and consultation with specialists. description: A maximum cap of 20 fertile female dogs over six months at any breeding premise will apply if the legislation passes.

description: MEXICO CITY—Hurricane Kristy strengthened into a Category 5 storm on Thursday and was expected to remain away from land as it churns in the Pacific Ocean and weakens over the coming days, forecasters said. The major hurricane was 970 miles southwest of the southern tip of the Baja California peninsula of Mexico, and was moving […]
title: Hurricane Kristy Strengthens Into Category 5 Storm in Pacific Ocean

description: A man in his 40s was euthanized after experiencing “post-vaccine syndrome,” following three shots of the COVID-19 vaccine, according to a joint report from the Ontario Solicitor General and Office of the Chief Coroner. The case falls at the nexus of two controversial issues. One is the impacts of COVID-19 vaccines, with protests and pushback […]
